item.title: UK Engineering Giant IMI Hit by Cyberattack
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
UK engineering firm IMI says it suffered a cyberattack that resulted in unauthorized access to some of its systems.

The post UK Engineering Giant IMI Hit by Cyberattack appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Industry Moves for the week of February 3, 2025 - SecurityWeek
item.description: Explore industry moves and significant changes in the industry for the week of February 3, 2025. Stay updated with the latest industry trends and shifts.

item.title: 430,000 Impacted by Data Breaches at New York, Pennsylvania Healthcare Organizations
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
University Diagnostic Medical Imaging and Allegheny Health Network have disclosed data breaches impacting approximately 430,000 patients.

The post 430,000 Impacted by Data Breaches at New York, Pennsylvania Healthcare Organizations appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Ransomware Payments Dropped to $813 Million in 2024
item.dc:creator: Eduard Kovacs
item.description:
An analysis by Chainalysis shows that ransomware payments dropped to $813 million in 2024, from $1.25 billion in 2023.Â 

The post Ransomware Payments Dropped to $813 Million in 2024 appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Trimble Cityworks Customers Warned of Zero-Day Exploitation
item.dc:creator: Eduard Kovacs
item.description:
Trimble Cityworks is affected by a zero-day vulnerability that has been exploited in attacks involving the delivery of malware.

The post Trimble Cityworks Customers Warned of Zero-Day Exploitation appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: House Lawmakers Push to Ban AI App DeepSeek From US Government Devices
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.description:
A bipartisan duo in the the U.S. House is proposing legislation to ban the Chinese artificial intelligence app DeepSeek from federal devices.

The post House Lawmakers Push to Ban AI App DeepSeek From US Government Devices appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: 1,000 Apps Used in Malicious Campaign Targeting Android Users in India
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
Zimperium warns that threat actors have stolen the information of tens of thousands of Android users in India using over 1,000 malicious applications.

The post 1,000 Apps Used in Malicious Campaign Targeting Android Users in India appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Astra, Invary Raise Millions for AI-Powered Pentesting, Runtime Security
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
Astra Security and Invary have received new funding to fuel development of their vulnerability scanning and runtime security solutions.

The post Astra, Invary Raise Millions for AI-Powered Pentesting, Runtime Security appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Hacker Who Targeted NATO, US Army Arrested in Spain
item.dc:creator: Eduard Kovacs
item.description:
Spanish authorities have arrested an individual who allegedly hacked several high-profile organizations, including NATO and the US army.

The post Hacker Who Targeted NATO, US Army Arrested in Spain appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Five Eyes Agencies Release Guidance on Securing Edge Devices
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
Five Eyes cybersecurity agencies have released guidance on securing edge devices against increasing threats.

The post Five Eyes Agencies Release Guidance on Securing Edge Devices appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.dc:creator: Joshua Goldfarb
item.description:
